TopicTitle: [Help!] My Rover Sinks Through the Ground! (Ã‚Â´Ã¯Â½Â¥Ã�â€°Ã¯Â½Â¥`)

Articles.Content:
I've tried saving it as a subassembly and loading it in VPH and the launchpad, changing the wheels, but they all sink and the rover refuses to move, the wheels do rotate however (Ã‚Â´Ã¯Â½Â¥Ãâ€°Ã¯Â½Â¥`)

What s wrong with it?
Your wheels are on sideways. The way wheels are implemented means that the physics shape for them isn't the same as the visual shape, so they only work properly at their default rotation.

Tried getting them aligned, still sinks (Ã‚Â´Ã¯Â½Â¥Ãâ€°Ã¯Â½Â¥`)

This one here has default rotation (new wheels straight from the part list)
Your wheels need to have the top facing upward, and the wheels being the bottommost part of the rotated wheel. You can't have the suspension (top part) at a 90 degree angle.

Tried getting them aligned, still sinks (Ã‚Â´Ã¯Â½Â¥Ãâ€°Ã¯Â½Â¥`)

This one here has default rotation (new wheels straight from the part list)

Those are still sideways, they must be changing automatically when you attach them, or something. The bracket which attaches them to the vehicle is T-shaped. It must be upright (i.e. wide bit at the top, like the letter itself).
